intro: Turraea somaliensis, commonly known as the Somali turraea, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its ecological significance and limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
